definition: misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours

sentences.english: Resilience is not simply an individual characteristic or a psychological phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 适应力不单单是个体特征或者心理现象。

sentences.english: Speaking of Fortune kiln, not only hemp cities, mountains are famous throughout the eastern Hubei.
sentences.chinese: 说起富鑫窑，不单麻城市，整个鄂东山区都赫赫有名。

sentences.english: Mr Garriott, however, is not just a holiday-maker.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，加雷特先生不单单是来度假的。

sentences.english: So, there is more useful purposes than that than just taking remainders.
sentences.chinese: 当然还有一些其他用途，不单单是取余数。

sentences.english: The minimum wage is not just about the economy, but humanity.
sentences.chinese: 最低工资不单是经济问题，也是人道问题。

sentences.english: It's not merely a function of technique.
sentences.chinese: 这不单单是技术的一个功能。

sentences.english: The blood of Jesus Christ not only redeems us, it justifies us.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣基督的宝血不单拯救我们，也赦免了我们的罪。

sentences.english: Violence is not only physical assault.
sentences.chinese: 暴力不单是身体上的伤害。

sentences.english: Viewers flocked to the program for its off-screen scandals as well as for the on-screen romance.
sentences.chinese: 不单是节目上的浪漫，幕后的丑闻也吸引着眼球。

sentences.english: Not only do the police harass Omar but, he says, the Lebanese do as well.
sentences.chinese: 奥马尔讲，不单是警察欺负他，黎巴嫩人也欺负他。

sentences.english: It is not merely Socrates who is on trial.
sentences.chinese: 不单仅是苏格拉底受审。

sentences.english: The mass media is not simply a window on the world.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒不单单是世界之窗。

sentences.english: Of misfortunes never come singly is, united States China also is produced because of embarrassing, die in the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 祸不单行的是，美华也因为难产，死在医院里。

sentences.english: Not only is the number of ex-leaders growing.
sentences.chinese: 不单单是干预的往届领导人的数量增加。

sentences.english: Economic disaster has coincided with political chaos.
sentences.chinese: 祸不单行，经济灾难与政治混乱结伴同行。

sentences.english: A：Yesterday wad a real double whammy.

definition: not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
needless to say/it goes without saying
